column4: put your question to the channel, don't pick a single nick/user for your question, so  "everybody" will read it and eventually answer
do you know how to do it ?
your description is (for me) a bit hazy, what is your configuration and what are you trying to accomplish?

slestak, mdm,   computerA is on internal wifi that has no outside internet,  computerB eth1 on internal wifi,  computerB eth0 is on internet.  I want computerA to be able to get internet through computerB.
what OS runs on B?
all are ubuntu
so you want to share the internet connection from Computer A via wifi with B?
I can't explain it any better than I just did
I asked a yes/no question
no.  reread what I said
computerA is on internal wifi that has no outside internet,  computerB eth1 on internal wifi,  computerB eth0 is on internet.  I want computerA to be able to get internet through computerB.
I mixed it up: so you want to share the internet connection from Computer B via wifi with A?
yeah I guess so
did you have a look at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetConnectionSharing ?
system/administartion/time ...
try powertop
so powertop is telling me what the cpu is waking up for but not amps or volts or watts of power
in fact it says  no ACPI power usage estimate available
it does if you pull the AC plug and run on battery
it's not a desktop....
i mean uhh   not a laptop.
no ACPI power usage estimate available
then I don't know - sorry - as far as I know the kernel modules all are observing the battery current
